artist: Engraver: Robert Dunkarton; Artist: After Philip Reinagle; Artist: Moonlight by William Pether; Publisher: Dr. Robert John Thornton
creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
medium: Mezzotint, printed in color and hand-colored
portfolio: From New Illustration of the Sexual System of Linnaeus, Part Three. The Temple of Flora, London, 1799-1807
text: Though his attempt to publish The Temple of Flora bankrupted him, Robert Thornton earned enduring fame for his efforts. Of the lugubrious setting for what we know as the night-blooming cereus, he said, "in the night-blowing Cereusâ€¦ you have the moon playing on the dimpled water, and the turret-clock points XII, the hour at night when this flower is in its full expanse."
title: The Night-Blowing Cereus
